definitions.text: a short light gust of air
a light inflated pastry or puff shell
bedding made of two layers of cloth filled with stuffing and stitched together
a soft spherical object made from fluffy fibers; for applying powder to the skin
thick cushion used as a seat
a slow inhalation (as of tobacco smoke)
examples: he took a puff on his pipe
he took a drag on his cigarette and expelled the smoke slowly

definitions.text: forceful exhalation through the nose or mouth
examples: he gave his nose a loud blow
he blew out all the candles with a single puff

definitions.text: breathe noisily, as when one is exhausted
examples: The runners reached the finish line, panting heavily
The sudden fame puffed her ego
The critics puffed up this Broadway production

definitions.text: speak in a blustering or scornful manner
to swell or cause to enlarge,
examples: Her faced puffed up from the drugs
he huffed and puffed as he made his way up the mountain
